page.title: 18The Youth Centre - Horndon
page.content: The Centre occupies the old primary school, built in 1847, on the corner of High Road and Vincent Avenue. It is used every day for the playgroup or the Mum's and Toddlers Club. The Youth Centre is open on four evenings. The children taking the Duke of Edinburgh Award Scheme meet on Tuesday evening. There are now 70 members in the senior group and 75 in the junior. About 55 juniour members, who must be 10, attend each Friday. The members take part in all the usual activities and table tennis - snooker and use the school field for football, rounders and netball on the netball court and playground. The school hall is used for badminton and gymnastics. They now have a yearly senior citizens party for Horndon residents. The money for this is raised by sponsored events
